output:
• Used for iterating over a sequence
• Syntax: for i in range(n):
• Executes block n times

• Loop runs while condition is true
• Syntax: while condition:
• Useful when number of iterations is unknown

| Key | Value |
|-----|-------|
| 'a' | 1     |
| 'b' | 2     |
• Mutable key-value pairs
• Access by key

• Defined using `def` keyword
• Can return values
• Support default and keyword arguments

• Concise way to create lists
• Syntax: [expression for item in iterable if condition]
• More readable and faster than loops

• Use `try-except` blocks
• Can catch specific exceptions
• `finally` block runs regardless of exceptions

• Blueprint for creating objects
• Use `class` keyword
• Support inheritance and encapsulation

• Anonymous functions
• Syntax: `lambda arguments: expression`
• Useful for short throwaway functions

• Use `open()` to read/write files
• Modes: 'r', 'w', 'a', 'rb', 'wb'
• Use `with` to auto-close files

• Functions that modify behavior of other functions
• Syntax: `@decorator`
• Used for logging, access control, etc.

• Use `yield` to produce values lazily
• More memory efficient than lists
• Can be iterated with loops

• Used for pattern matching
• Module: `re`
• Common functions: `match`, `search`, `findall`

• Unordered collections of unique items
• Support union, intersection, difference
• Syntax: `{1, 2, 3}`

• Function calls itself
• Must have base case
• Useful for tree and graph problems

• Files containing Python code
• Import using `import module`
• Can define functions, classes, variables

| Feature      | List           | Tuple         |
|--------------|----------------|---------------|
| Mutability   | Mutable        | Immutable     |
| Syntax       | [1, 2, 3]      | (1, 2, 3)     |
| Use Case     | Data that changes | Fixed data |

• Key-value pairs
• Keys must be immutable
• Syntax: `{ 'key': 'value' }`

• Applies a function to all items
• Syntax: `map(func, iterable)`
• Returns an iterator

• Filters items based on condition
• Syntax: `filter(func, iterable)`
• Returns an iterator

• Extract parts of a list
• Syntax: `list[start:end:step]`
• Supports negative indices

• Operators: `and`, `or`, `not`
• Used in conditions
• Short-circuit evaluation

• Methods: `%` operator, `.format()`, f-strings
• f-strings preferred (Python 3.6+)
• Syntax: `f"Hello {name}"`

• Isolates project dependencies
• Created using `venv` module
• Activate with `source venv/bin/activate` or `venv\Scripts\activate`

• Objects that implement `__iter__()` and `__next__()`
• Used in loops
• Can be custom created

• Python style guide
• Naming conventions, indentation, line length
• Promotes readable code

• Use `logging` module
• Levels: DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL
• Configurable handlers and formatters

| Feature         | Multithreading    | Multiprocessing    |
|-----------------|-------------------|--------------------|
| Uses            | Threads           | Processes          |
| GIL Impact      | Limited concurrency| True parallelism   |
| Use Case        | I/O-bound tasks   | CPU-bound tasks    |

• Use `with` statement
• Ensures resource cleanup
• Example: `with open('file') as f:`

• Simplify class boilerplate
• Use `@dataclass` decorator
• Auto-generates init, repr, eq methods

• append(), extend(), insert(), remove(), pop()
• sort(), reverse(), clear()
• Modify lists in-place

• Process used by plants to make food
• Converts sunlight, CO₂, and water into glucose
• Occurs in chloroplasts

• Cultural movement in Europe (14th–17th century)
• Revival of art, science, and literature
• Figures: Da Vinci, Michelangelo

• Breaks down food into nutrients
• Main organs: stomach, intestines, liver
• Absorbs nutrients and expels waste

• Wrote tragedies, comedies, and histories
• Famous works: Hamlet, Macbeth, Othello
• Rich in language and dramatic themes

• Crust, mantle, outer core, inner core
• Each layer has different composition and temperature
• Core is mostly iron and nickel

• Provides body structure and protection
• Adults have 206 bones
• Works with muscles for movement

• Known for black-and-white landscape photography
• Focused on American West, especially Yosemite
• Advocated for conservation

• Includes evaporation, condensation, precipitation
• Driven by the sun’s energy
• Essential for Earth's ecosystems

• Began in 1789
• Overthrew monarchy and feudal system
• Led to rise of Napoleon Bonaparte

• Helps absorb calcium for bone health
• Produced by skin in sunlight
• Found in fatty fish and supplements

• Sequences of notes in a specific order
• Major scales sound happy, minor sound sad
• Basis of melodies and harmonies

• Includes 8 planets orbiting the Sun
• Inner planets: rocky; Outer planets: gas giants
• Also contains moons, asteroids, comets

• Japanese poetic form
• 3 lines with 5-7-5 syllables
• Often about nature or fleeting moments

• Defends against infections and diseases
• Includes white blood cells and antibodies
• Has innate and adaptive components

• Global war (1939–1945)
• Axis vs Allies
• Major events: Holocaust, D-Day, atomic bomb

• Earth's surface is divided into plates
• Move due to mantle convection
• Cause earthquakes, volcanoes, mountains

• International sports event every 4 years
• Includes summer and winter games
• Promotes unity and athletic excellence

• Cirrus: wispy and high
• Cumulus: puffy and white
• Stratus: flat layers; Nimbostratus: rain clouds

• Balance of fruits, vegetables, proteins, and grains
• Limit added sugars and saturated fats
• Stay hydrated

• Series of fortifications
• Built to protect Chinese states from invasions
• Spans over 13,000 miles
